News.Title: Atlantaa Limited Q3FY26 Results Show Mixed Performance
News.Summary: Atlantaa Limited reported Q3FY26 standalone net profit of ₹158.25 lakhs vs ₹3,664.18 lakhs in Q3FY25. Revenue from operations declined to ₹454.22 lakhs from ₹1,400.35 lakhs YoY.

News.Title: Atlantaa Limited Company Secretary Resigns
News.Summary: CS Mamta Jain has resigned from her position as Company Secretary & Compliance Officer at Atlantaa Limited due to personal reasons, effective February 06, 2026.

News.Title: Atlantaa Registers ₹500 Cr GDV Development Agreement
News.Summary: Atlantaa Limited formally registers development agreement with Highway Milton Co-operative Housing Society for Borivali East redevelopment project with estimated GDV of ₹500 crores.

News.Title: Atlantaa Limited Appoints New Company Secretary as Prathmesh Gaonkar Resigns
News.Summary: Atlantaa Limited announced the resignation of Company Secretary Prathmesh Pradeep Gaonkar (ACS No. A61307) and the appointment of Mrs. Mamta Jain (ACS No. A72257) as the new Company Secretary & Compliance Officer, both effective from 06.12.2025. Gaonkar, who joined in March 2023, resigned to pursue better career opportunities and start his own practicing firm, while Jain brings 4 years of post-qualification experience working with listed and private companies.

News.Title: Atlantaa Limited Reports Quarterly Loss of Rs 17.49 Crore Due to Rs 21.80 Crore Legal Settlement Payment
News.Summary: Atlantaa Limited posted a net loss of Rs 17.49 crore for the quarter ended September 30, 2025, compared to a profit of Rs 13.19 crore in the previous quarter, primarily due to a Rs 21.80 crore payment made to Uttar Pradesh Public Works Department during a pending arbitration appeal. The company's total income from operations declined to Rs 3.60 crore from Rs 26.44 crore in the previous quarter, while the Board approved these unaudited financial results in their November 14, 2025 meeting.

News.Title: Atlantaa Shares Hit 20% Upper Circuit for Second Day After ₹2,485 Crore IRCON Order
News.Summary: Atlantaa Ltd. shares locked in 20% upper circuit for the second consecutive day following announcement of a ₹2,485 crore contract win from IRCON International. The company will construct the Bhandara-Gadchiroli Access Controlled Expressway in Maharashtra on EPC mode, specifically package BG-03 from Sarandi to Kinhi. The order value is approximately 6 times Atlantaa's market capitalization of ₹456 crore. Trading volume exceeded 40 lakh shares, significantly above the 20-day average of 3.4 lakh shares. This marks the fourth 20% upper circuit since September 1. The stock now trades at ₹55.96 and has turned positive year-to-date, gaining 101% in 2024. Promoters hold 74.67% stake while retail investors with up to ₹2 lakh authorized capital hold 13.17%. No mutual funds have exposure to the stock.

News.Title: Atlanaa Co Signs ₹2,485 Crore Agreement with IRCON for Maharashtra Expressway Project
News.Summary: Atlanaa Co has entered into an agreement with IRCON for the Bhandara-Gadchiroli Expressway project in Maharashtra, valued at ₹2,485 crore. The infrastructure project involves the development of an expressway connecting Bhandara and Gadchiroli districts in the state.

News.Title: Nitin Castings Reports 57% Drop in Net Profit Despite Revenue Growth in Q1 FY2026
News.Summary: Nitin Castings Limited, a manufacturer of alloy steel castings, reported mixed quarterly results. Revenue increased 2.0% year-over-year to ₹3,914.83 lakhs but declined 5.4% sequentially from the previous quarter. Net profit after tax dropped significantly by 57.0% to ₹245.39 lakhs compared to ₹570.59 lakhs in the same quarter last year, and fell 38.0% from the previous quarter. Earnings per share decreased from ₹11.10 to ₹4.77 year-over-year. The company faces margin pressure and cost management challenges despite maintaining revenue growth in the cyclical steel industry.

News.Title: Atlantaa Limited Approves Q1 FY26 Results and Key Board Appointments
News.Summary: Atlantaa Limited's board approved unaudited financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. The company reported standalone revenue of Rs 644.48 lakhs and net profit of Rs 53.85 lakhs for the quarter. Consolidated revenue stood at Rs 1,912.00 lakhs with a net loss of Rs 171.03 lakhs. The board also appointed an Internal Auditor for FY 2025-26, re-appointed Mr. Rickiin R Bbarot as Managing Director for 5 years from December 31, 2025, and re-appointed Mrs. Bhumika Pandey as Independent Director for 5 years from February 12, 2026. The company approved its annual report for FY 2024-25 and scheduled its 42nd Annual General Meeting for September 29, 2025. Atlantaa Limited operates in construction and infrastructure development in India.

News.Title: Atlantaa Limited Receives IVR BB+/Stable & IVR A4+ Credit Rating for Rs. 100 Crore Bank Facilities
News.Summary: Atlantaa Limited has been assigned credit ratings of IVR BB+/Stable for long-term and IVR A4+ for short-term bank facilities worth Rs. 100 crore by Infomerics Valuation and Rating Limited. The rating was assigned on July 21, 2025, for proposed long-term/short-term bank facilities including bank guarantees. The IVR BB+ rating indicates moderate risk of default regarding timely servicing of financial obligations, while IVR A4+ suggests minimal degree of safety for short-term payment obligations with very high credit risk. The rating is valid for one year from July 16, 2025, with formal surveillance typically conducted within 12 months.
